connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from Vert.x Event Bus.

camel.sink.path.address.name: camel.sink.path.address
camel.sink.path.address.description: Sets the event bus address used to communicate

camel.sink.endpoint.pubSub.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pubSub
camel.sink.endpoint.pubSub.description: Whether to use publish/subscribe instead of point to point when sending to a vertx endpoint.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.vertx.host.name: camel.component.vertx.host
camel.component.vertx.host.description: Hostname for creating an embedded clustered EventBus

camel.component.vertx.port.name: camel.component.vertx.port
camel.component.vertx.port.description: Port for creating an embedded clustered EventBus

camel.component.vertx.timeout.name: camel.component.vertx.timeout
camel.component.vertx.timeout.description: Timeout in seconds to wait for clustered Vertx EventBus to be ready. The default value is 60.

camel.component.vertx.vertx.name: camel.component.vertx.vertx
camel.component.vertx.vertx.description: To use the given vertx EventBus instead of creating a new embedded EventBus

camel.component.vertx.vertxOptions.name: camel.component.vertx.vertxOptions
camel.component.vertx.vertxOptions.description: Options to use for creating vertx

camel.component.vertx.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.vertx.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.vertx.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.vertx.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.vertx.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.vertx.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.vertx.vertxFactory.name: camel.component.vertx.vertxFactory
camel.component.vertx.vertxFactory.description: To use a custom VertxFactory implementation
